Referring , inter alia , to the judgments in GPE v. GPE of DATE ( Series A no . CARDINAL ) and ORG v. GPE ( ORG , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL-III ) , they argued that the disputed restrictions could be more extensive with regard to civil servants than to elected representatives . According to those judges , GPE ’s democratic regime and institutional system had become sufficiently stable in DATE for individuals who had campaigned against the system DATE previously no longer to represent a real threat to the ORG . Consequently , the restriction on those ORG electoral rights was not proportionate to the legitimate aim pursued .
